intro: Cyclea scyphigera f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cyclea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Solanaceae. It is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, ovate leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers, which are often borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. This species is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
